title: How to Wash Your Hair Using Only Natural Ingredients

steps.title: Dissolve about 1 tablespoon of baking soda in just enough water to make a paste.
steps.content: Dissolve about 1 tablespoon of baking soda in just enough water to make a paste. Apply this to your roots only; work it in and let it sit for a minute. [1] X Research source Baking soda is a great natural exfoliator that cleanses your hair and scalp.

steps.title: Stimulate blood flow, clean your pores and get off built up grime, use your finger tips to scrub your scalp.
steps.content: Stimulate blood flow, clean your pores and get off built up grime, use your finger tips to scrub your scalp . Start by making a circle on the top of your head in the area you'd wear a crown. Focus on the back of this circle to begin with. Next, fill in the circle. This is where your part will be; grease here affects the way your hair looks. Trace while still scrubbing with your fingertips around the bottom edge of the circle. Keep making scrubbing circles underneath each one, drawing lines in circles around your head. [2] X Research source Lastly, scrub the back of your skull and your temples/sideburns. This will result in less grease and more growth. After doing this, your scalp will feel alive. Some people say their hair grows faster after a visit to the salon â€” it does, and this massage method is why.

steps.title: Pour about 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar into a cup and add water.
steps.content: Pour about 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar into a cup and add water. (Try keeping two plastic 12-ounce cups in your shower and just mix when you get in.) After you rinse the baking soda out, pour the apple cider vinegar over the ends of your hair, let it sit for a minute and then rinse it out. That's all there is to it! [3] X Research source Use this baking soda and apple cider vinegar method if you have oily hair or dandruff. Aim to do this hair treatment every once in a while rather than every day, as it could dry out your hair.

steps.title: Soak a handful of soap nuts (about 8-10 for medium-length hair) in about 300 milliliters (10 fl oz) of water overnight.
steps.content: Soak a handful of soap nuts (about 8-10 for medium-length hair) in about 300 milliliters (10 fl oz) of water overnight. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wait till morning.
steps.content: Wait till morning. Squeeze and pulp the softened soap-nuts with your fingers. Discard the seeds.

steps.title: Use the resulting liquid just as you would use a shampoo, only more liberally.
steps.content: Use the resulting liquid just as you would use a shampoo, only more liberally.

steps.title: Apply, leave it on for 2 minutes, and wash off.
steps.content: Apply, leave it on for 2 minutes, and wash off. It's okay if some of the pulp gets into your hair - it'll all wash off. It will leave only a fresh clean feeling and a faint whiff of leaves.

steps.title: Use a natural conditioner if you find your hair too dry.
steps.content: Use a natural conditioner if you find your hair too dry. You can use a beaten egg (leave it on for a few minutes, once you are ready in the shower), or coconut oil (applied and massaged into the hair 30 minutes in advance) before using the soap-nut solution. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Discard any leftover liquid and all the pulp, as it can get smelly the next day.
steps.content: Discard any leftover liquid and all the pulp, as it can get smelly the next day.
